name: Vulfpeck
description: '''Vulfpeck''' is an American [[funk]]/[[soul music|soul]] band formed in [[Ann Arbor, Michigan]], in 2011. Founded by multi-instrumentalist [[Jack Stratton (musician)|Jack Stratton]], the band includes core members [[Theo Katzman]], Woody Goss, and Joe Dart, musical partners [[Cory Wong]], [[Antwaun Stanley]], [[Joey Dosik]], and [[Jacob Jeffries Band|Jacob Jeffries]], and a changing lineup of guest musicians. The band has released six studio albums, four [[extended plays]], a compilation,{{efn|name=compilations}} and two live albums through their [[Independent music|own record label]]. The band gained recognition in 2014 for releasing ''[[Sleepify]]'', a silent album that exposed a loophole in [[Spotify]]'s royalty distribution and funded an admission-free tour. The band is one of the first to sell out [[Madison Square Garden]] without a manager or backing label, and released the recorded performance as a live album in 2019. The band's most recent album, ''MSG II'', was released in December 2025.
